issue.title: DRC Sim doesn't contain ground_plane or sun models that the default environment uses

content.html:
The problem is that ground_plane and sun are stored in the model database and need to be (automatically) downloaded first in order to use them (they're downloaded to .gazebo/models/) but the drcsim setup script unsets the required GAZEBO_MODEL_DATABASE_URI environment variable. In order for you to fix this on your computer you just need to execute "export GAZEBO_MODEL_DATABASE_URI=http://gazebosim.org/models" after loading the drcsim setup script (e.g. either put it in your command line after sourcing the setup.sh or in your .bashrc if you're already loading the setup script there).

After doing so ground_plane and sun should be downloaded to ~/.gazebo/models/ and successfully loaded in gazebo.

@OSRF: if you want DRC users to be independent of their internet connection these files should be added to the DRC or Gazebo package. (independence of a fast internet connection was the reason for unsetting the environment variable I think .. downloading ground_plane or sun does not require a good internet connection though, so I guess you could as well just not unset it? Maybe you should display a warning and/or progress bar though when downloading large models like the PR2, otherwise users will go nuts over Gazebo freezing for some seconds because they don't know that gazebo is downloading files in the background)
